timer

Interface Timer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BubbleSortTimer, CharacterBubbleSortTimer, IntegerBubbleSortTimer, SequentialSearcherSubstringSizeTimer, SequentialSearcherSuperstringSizeTimer

    public interface Timer
    Defines a time method that can be used to time a given method in implementing classes. This is known as the timed method. Each timer.Timer object is expected to have some int measure of the "size" of the task the timed method has to undertake.
    Version:
    September 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getMaximumRuntime()
      A timer.Timer object shoud specify the maximum length of time that a time test should run
      int getMaximumTaskSize()
      timer.Timer objects must also specify the maximum task size that they wish to see timed.
      int getMinimumTaskSize()
      timer.Timer objects must also specify the minimum task size that they wish to see timed.
      int getRunSetSize()
      To try to average random fluctuations, each problem size will be timed a number of times.
      Timer getTimer(int size)
      Get a timer.Timer object with a task of the given size for the timed method.
      default java.time.Duration time()
      Run the timed method belonging to an implementing class, and time how long it takes.
      void timedMethod()
      Nominate the timed method.
      default void timingSequence()
      Run a sequence of time tests of increasing size.

    • Method Detail

      • getTimer

        Timer getTimer(int size)
        Get a timer.Timer object with a task of the given size for the timed method.
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the task to be timed.
        Returns:
        a timer.Timer object with a task of that size

      • timedMethod

        void timedMethod()
        Nominate the timed method. In an implementing class timedMethod will be a wrapper method for the method to be timed.

      • getMaximumRuntime

        long getMaximumRuntime()
        A timer.Timer object shoud specify the maximum length of time that a time test should run
        Returns:
        the maximum time that a single time test should run, in seconds

      • getMinimumTaskSize

        int getMinimumTaskSize()
        timer.Timer objects must also specify the minimum task size that they wish to see timed.
        Returns:
        the maximum task size to be timed

      • getMaximumTaskSize

        int getMaximumTaskSize()
        timer.Timer objects must also specify the maximum task size that they wish to see timed.
        Returns:
        the maximum task size to be timed

      • time

        default java.time.Duration time()
        Run the timed method belonging to an implementing class, and time how long it takes.
        Returns:
        the time taken to execute the method being timed, in nanoseconds

      • getRunSetSize

        int getRunSetSize()
        To try to average random fluctuations, each problem size will be timed a number of times.
        Returns:
        the number of times each problem size should be timed

      • timingSequence

        default void timingSequence()
        Run a sequence of time tests of increasing size. Task sizes of size 1,2,..,9, then 10,20,..,90 and so on for increasing powers of ten are timed. The sequence of tests terminates when the execution time of the timed method reaches or surpasses the time limit, or the size of the generator reaches or surpasses the maximum size.
